place.name: BETWS DISERTH
place.gazetteerText: BETTWS-DISSERTH, a parochial chapelry in the district of Builth and county of Radnor; on the river Edwy, 7 miles SW of New Radnor, and 12 W of Kington r. station. Post Town, New Radnor. Acres, 1,885. Real property, £810. Pop., 130. Houses, 19. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the rectory of Disserth, in the diocese of St. David's. The church is excellent. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
